instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
All S5 rails are present. No water damage. Can fin the short on PP5V_S3. 


Any idea?

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Short means what?
Post exact value to ground, ohm scale.
Do you get at least a pulse on PM_SLP_S4_L, triggering SMC_ONOFF_L?

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: 0.5ohms to ground. Not getting pulse on PM_SLP_S4. not triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Half ohm is low enough to heat something injecting voltage there.
Start with 1V and go up...

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: already tried. but seems nothing heat up except cables i am injecting with. Tried up to 3V, same result

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Let ampers limit at max on lab power supply; and start with low voltage.

You are in the case where high current is required.
I already posted links for 20-40A power supplies on the forum...

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Something must absolutely get hot....inspect caps by Audio IC common short on 13" unibodies

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: checked, injecting 2.43Amps with 4V through C4690 pin 1 and absolutely nothing is getting not warm. checked everything.

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: C6213 was the problem. Thank you. U were right it was getting very hot.

threads.title: 820-2879 not turning on PP5V_S3 shorted, no PM_SLP_S4_L
